newsitem.title: UK: Thermo makes agreed bid for Life Sciences.
newsitem.headline: Thermo makes agreed bid for Life Sciences.

text.p: Thermo Instrument Systems Inc of the U.S. said on Tuesday that it has made a recommended cash offer for Life Sciences International Plc, valuing the scientific equipment producer at 235.9 million stg.
The offer will be 135p per share in Life Sciences.
Life Sciences said in a statement that it intends to declare a second interim dividend, in lieu of any final dividend, for the year ended December 31, 1996 of 3.0p per share.
It said the offer, together with the second interim dividend, represented a premium of around 49 percent over Monday's closing middle market quotation of 92.5p per Life share.
Life Sciences said it expected its profit before tax and exceptional items for the year ended December 31, 1996 to be around 27.0 million stg.
Christopher Bland, chairman of Life Sciences, said: "Thermo Instrument will bring to Life Sciences greater financial resources, operating synergies and further expansion opportunities."
